personal.name: Amos Cohen
personal.title: Product Manager
personal.profile: I am a driven product creator with diverse experience in engineering, design, and business. My track record includes solving complex problems and navigating technical challenges by applying logic and accelerated self-learning. When I'm not thinking about problems, you will find me cooking Middle Eastern food, listening to music, or fragging n00bs in CS:GO.

responsibilities: Led product a 12-person cross-functional team in delivering a SaaS product, helping our clients adapt to new data protection regulations while maintaining advertising returns.
Led a 10-person team to transition an internal product from proof-of-concept to MVP in 3 months, to  deliver reliable and consistent actionable insights.
Owned product in an agile workstream for a healthcare Salesforce implementation project.
Managed end-to-end delivery of web services for 20+ clients in Europe and Israel, from concept to production.
Designed and developed 12+ high-performing ecommerce experiences for businesses of various scales, using WordPress or Shopify to adapt to changing demand for custom solutions.
Championed a user-centric approach to web development, resulting in a 20% reduction in cycle time and a 15% increase in clients' LTV.

Provided programming support to over 500+ collegiate athlete websites. I effectively communicated with customer support representatives who provided me with technical issues raised by clients and implemented accordingly.
Implemented ADA-compliant code written in HTML and C# for over 50% of the companyâ€™s portfolio, resulting in WCGAG AA compliance.
Assisted the Director of BXLP SU in consulting to student-startups in different stages (ideation, acceleration, investment).

Prepared students for pitch competitions and guided founders to create investment-ready assets for their ventures, primarily business plan componentes. Three of those startups were funded with over $2M seed investments.
Launched a weekly revenue stream that added a 10% recurring revenue for the firm.
Successfully strategized and executed a digital strategy that included launching an ecommerce channel targeted at three universities located in the vicinity.
K&P is a family business in Israel which imported foods from Italy and Sweden and resold to large retailers and wholesalers.

Developed and implemented a cost-effective logistics strategy to optimize supply chain operations, reducing transportation costs by 15% and improving delivery times by 20% for K&P's Swedish food imports.
Successfully negotiated and executed a white labeling agreement with a large retailer, increasing brand exposure and revenue for K&P's imported food products.
Served as Commander, Sergeant and Company Sergeant Major. Commanded 6 cycles of new recruits over the course of 3 years, leading and guiding hundreds of recruits.
